actor_awards.notes: Renowned for playing the 'Saint' and the 'Falcon' in film series, and Shere Khan in The Jungle Book.

filmography.title: Lloyd's of London
filmography.role_description: A haughty aristocrat and rival to the protagonist; the role that first brought Sanders to Hollywood attention.
filmography.plot: A childhood friendship between a young boy and Horatio Nelson shapes the history of the British Empire and the Lloyd's insurance syndicate.

filmography.title: Lancer Spy
filmography.role: Baron Kurt von Rohback / Lt. Michael Bruce
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing a captured German officer and the British naval officer who impersonates him.
filmography.plot: A British officer impersonates a look-alike German Baron to steal military secrets in Berlin.

filmography.title: The Saint Strikes Back
filmography.role_description: The suave, vigilante adventurer known as 'The Saint' who helps a woman clear her father's name.
filmography.plot: Simon Templar helps a woman whose father was framed by a criminal gang in San Francisco.

filmography.title: Confessions of a Nazi Spy
filmography.role_description: A sinister Nazi agent operating in the United States, showcasing Sanders' ability to play chilling villains.
filmography.plot: An FBI agent investigates a spy ring in the U.S. that is stealing military secrets and spreading Nazi propaganda.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Best Film

filmography.title: Rebecca
filmography.role_description: The sleazy, blackmailing cousin of the deceased Rebecca who torments Laurence Olivier's Maxim de Winter.
filmography.plot: A self-conscious woman juggles adjusting to her new role as an aristocrat's wife and avoiding being intimidated by his first wife's spectral presence.

filmography.title: Foreign Correspondent
filmography.role_description: A witty, unflappable English journalist who aids an American reporter in exposing a spy ring.
filmography.plot: An American reporter tries to expose enemy spies in London who are involved in a fictional continent-wide conspiracy.

filmography.title: Man Hunt
filmography.role_description: A polite but deadly Gestapo officer who hunts a British sportsman who had Hitler in his sights.
filmography.plot: A British hunter vacationing in Bavaria gets Hitler in his gun sight, is caught, beaten, and left for dead, but escapes back to London.

filmography.title: The Gay Falcon
filmography.role_description: A debonair troubleshooter and ladies' man who solves crimes; the first of his Falcon series roles.
filmography.plot: A suave amateur detective investigates a jewelry theft ring to clear his name.

filmography.title: Son of Fury: The Story of Benjamin Blake
filmography.role_description: The cruel uncle who cheats his nephew (Tyrone Power) out of his inheritance and forces him into servitude.
filmography.plot: A young man fights to reclaim his rightful inheritance from his scheming uncle in 18th-century England.

filmography.title: The Black Swan
filmography.role_description: A flamboyant, red-bearded pirate captain who rivals Tyrone Power in this Technicolor swashbuckler.
filmography.plot: A reformed pirate helps the governor of Jamaica rid the Caribbean of the buccaneers who refuse to give up their trade.

filmography.title: The Moon and Sixpence
filmography.role_description: A British stockbroker who abandons his family to become a painter in Tahiti; based on Paul Gauguin.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged stockbroker abandons his job and family to pursue his passion for painting in the South Seas.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: This Land Is Mine
filmography.role_description: A railway superintendent in occupied France who collaborates with the Nazis, believing it's the only way to survive.
filmography.plot: A timid schoolteacher in an occupied country is forced to take a stand against the Nazis and collaborators.

filmography.title: The Lodger
filmography.role_description: The Scotland Yard inspector hunting Jack the Ripper in turn-of-the-century London.
filmography.plot: A landlady suspects her new lodger is the madman killing women in London.

filmography.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
filmography.role_description: The cynical, hedonistic aristocrat who corrupts the young Dorian Gray with his philosophy of pleasure.
filmography.plot: A corrupt young man somehow keeps his youthful beauty eternally, but a special painting gradually reveals his inner ugliness to all.

filmography.title: Hangover Square
filmography.role_description: A psychiatrist who tries to help a composer suffering from blackout periods that turn him violent.
filmography.plot: A composer tries to finish a concerto before his mental instability drives him to murder.

filmography.title: The Strange Woman
filmography.role_description: A lumber camp foreman who becomes the object of obsession for a manipulative woman played by Hedy Lamarr.
filmography.plot: A cruel woman manipulates three men—her husband, his son, and a foreman—to get what she wants.

filmography.title: The Ghost and Mrs. Muir
filmography.role_description: A charming children's author who romances the widow Mrs. Muir, only to be revealed as a married cad.
filmography.plot: A young widow forms a unique relationship with the ghost of a seaman and writes his memoirs.

filmography.title: Lured
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated nightclub owner and fiancé to Lucille Ball's character, who becomes a suspect in a serial killer case.
filmography.plot: A taxi dancer in London disappears, and her friend goes undercover for Scotland Yard to find a serial killer targeting young women.

filmography.title: Samson and Delilah
filmography.role_description: The cynical, powerful Philistine ruler who manipulates Delilah into betraying Samson.
filmography.plot: When strongman Samson rejects the love of the beautiful Philistine woman Delilah, she seeks vengeance that brings horrible consequences.

filmography.title: All About Eve
filmography.role_description: A venomous, powerful theater critic who sees through Eve's act and manipulates her in return; Sanders' Oscar-winning role.
filmography.plot: A timid but secretly ruthless ingénue insinuates herself into the life of an aging Broadway star, ultimately threatening her career and personal relationships.

filmography.title: Ivanhoe
filmography.role_description: A Norman Templar knight who is the formidable rival to Ivanhoe and falls in love with the Jewish healer Rebecca.
filmography.plot: A knight returns from the Crusades and seeks to restore the throne to King Richard while caught in a romantic triangle.

filmography.title: Call Me Madam
filmography.role_description: The charming Prime Minister of a fictional European duchy who romances the U.S. Ambassador.
filmography.plot: A boisterous socialite is appointed US Ambassador to a small European duchy, where romance ensues.

filmography.title: Journey to Italy
filmography.role_description: A cynical Englishman whose marriage to Ingrid Bergman disintegrates during a trip to Naples.
filmography.plot: An unhappy English couple travel to Naples to sell a villa, where the beautiful surroundings bring their marital problems to the surface.

filmography.title: King Richard and the Crusaders
filmography.role_description: The English King leading the Third Crusade, portrayed with regal authority and weariness.
filmography.plot: King Richard the Lionheart battles deceit within his own camp and the Saracen leader Saladin during the Crusades.

filmography.title: Moonfleet
filmography.role_description: A corrupt aristocrat involved with smugglers in 18th-century Dorset.
filmography.plot: A young boy discovers that his guardian is the leader of a band of smugglers.

filmography.title: While the City Sleeps
filmography.role_description: An ambitious wire service chief competing to catch a serial killer to win a promotion.
filmography.plot: Reporters at a newspaper compete to catch a serial killer, using their women as bait to get the scoop.

filmography.title: Village of the Damned
filmography.role_description: A physicist who studies and ultimately sacrifices himself to destroy a group of emotionless, telepathic alien children.
filmography.plot: In a small English village, all women of child-bearing age simultaneously become pregnant with sinister children.

filmography.title: A Shot in the Dark
filmography.role_description: A wealthy eccentric who becomes a suspect in a murder investigation led by Inspector Clouseau.
filmography.plot: Inspector Clouseau investigates a murder at a country estate where the main suspect is a beautiful maid.

filmography.title: The Jungle Book
filmography.role_description: The voice of the sophisticated, deadly Bengal tiger who hunts Mowgli; one of Disney's greatest villains.
filmography.plot: Bagheera the Panther and Baloo the Bear have a difficult time trying to convince a boy to leave the jungle for human civilization.

filmography.title: Psychomania
filmography.role_description: A sinister butler and servant of the devil who aids a frog-worshipping biker gang in their quest for immortality.
filmography.plot: A biker gang leader makes a pact with the devil to return from the dead, leading his gang on a murderous rampage.
